intro: Monnina pachycoma, commonly known as the thickleaf monnina, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well adapted to desert environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in xerophytic plant adaptations.
